Tutorial.description: This tutorial is about the Faction system

Start.Content: Welcome to the Faction Tutorial. This tutorial will explain how to manage your faction and how to keep your ships and homebase safe from players.

StateA.Content: Factions are a vital part of StarMade. Players can gather under 1 faction and work together to accomplish a common goal.

StateB.Content: Press '$FACTION_MENU' to open the faction panel. From here you can create and edit your own, or join an existing faction. The 'Faction hub' tab shows you an overview of all current factions in the game and allows you to join a public faction.

StateC.Content: To create a faction, click on 'Create new faction' in the 'Personal' tab. Choose a name and click OK. You can alternatively, also accept an invite by clicking on 'Invites'.

StateD.Content: In the "Faction" tab, you can manage your faction. You can add a description and write news posts. News will be visible for all members of your faction. You can also accept peace or alliance offers from other factions.

StateE.Content:
Each member of your faction has a rank. Ranks can be named and their permissions can be set when clicking the "Roles" button.
To change the name of a rank, click on the name.

StateF.Content: Edit: Members are able to edit description and post news. Kick: Members can kick players of a lower rank. Invite: Members are allowed to invite players to the faction. Permission-Edit: Only give this to faction leaders, as it enables them to modify the ranks.

StateG.Content: You can assign a rank to a player by clicking on 'options' next to his name. In that options menu you can see all ranks and the ability to kick that person from your faction.

StateH.Content: You can also choose from several faction options: 'Public faction' makes it possible for players to join without an invite. 'Declare war on hostile action' will auto declare war when you faction is attacked. 'Consider neutral enemy' will change the relationship with all faction-less entities to 'enemy'

StateI.Content: In the faction hub, you can declare war and send peace/alliance offers by clicking on the 'relation' next to the faction's name.

StateI1.Content: It is possible to assign a ship to your faction. Only you and your faction members will be able to use it. To do this, place a "faction module" on the ship, press $ACITVATE on it and enter the faction signature. The signature will stay as long as the faction block is not destroyed.

StateJ.Content: The same goes for a station, with the difference that you can also make a station a faction's homebase. Each faction can only have ONE homebase, as it has a very big advantage: Homebases and everything docked to it are invulnerable to damage.

StateK.Content: In the future there will be a system that allows some kind of faction war to deal with homebases.

StateL.Content: Factions can, instead of declaring war against a whole faction, declare war against a single player. This can be done in the 'Faction' tab and clicking on the 'Personal Enemies' button.

StateM.Content: Faction chat is also available by starting a message with '/f ' in chat, or by pressing shift+$CHAT to do that automatically.

End.Content: This concludes the Faction Tutorial. Thanks for reading, and thanks for playing StarMade!
